description: The Assistance for Quality Enhancement scheme in Rajasthan supports MSMEs in obtaining quality certifications and adopting advanced technologies to improve product quality and competitiveness. It provides financial assistance for certification and technology costs.

benefits.subsidy: Up to Rs. 2 Lakhs for quality certification and technology upgradation costs
benefits.reimbursement: 50% of certification costs, max Rs. 1 Lakh

business_criteria: Must be a registered MSME as per the MSME Development Act, 2006
operational_criteria: Must pursue recognized quality certifications (e.g., ISO, BIS)
Must invest in technology for quality improvement

eligible_activities: Obtaining quality certifications like ISO, BIS, or HACCP
Purchasing equipment or software for quality enhancement

steps: Visit the Rajasthan Industries Department portal or scheme website
Submit an online application with details of certification or technology investment
Upload required documents, including MSME registration and expense details
Applications are reviewed by the District Industries Centre (DIC)
Approved applicants receive the subsidy upon verification
application_process.note: Applicants must provide proof of certification or technology adoption

special_notes: The subsidy is limited to approved certifications and technologies
MSMEs must maintain certification for at least 3 years
Priority is given to export-oriented MSMEs
